intro: Synthyris platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited synthyris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the fruit is distinctive for its broad, flattened shape. Synthyris platycarpa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
